client_id.description: The OAuth2 Client ID for API operations.

client_secret.description: The OAuth2 Client Secret for API operations.

created_at.description: The time that the network peering was created.

expires_at.description: The time after which the network peering will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED` or `ACTIVE` state.

hvn_id.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organization_id.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the network peering is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

peer_account_id.description: The account ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peer_vpc_id.description: The ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peer_vpc_region.description: The region of the peer VPC in AWS.

peering_id.description: The ID of the network peering.

project_id.description: The ID of the HCP project where the network peering is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

provider_peering_id.description: The peering connection ID used by AWS.

self_link.description: A unique URL identifying the network peering.

block.description: The AWS network peering resource allows you to manage a network peering between an HVN and a peer AWS VPC.

created_at.description: The time that the transit gateway attachment was created.

expires_at.description: The time after which the transit gateway attachment will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED` or `ACTIVE` state.

hvn_id.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organization_id.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the transit gateway attachment is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

project_id.description: The ID of the HCP project where the transit gateway attachment is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

provider_transit_gateway_attachment_id.description: The transit gateway attachment ID used by AWS.

resource_share_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Resource Share that is needed to grant HCP access to the transit gateway in AWS. The Resource Share should be associated with the HCP AWS account principal (see [aws_ram_principal_association](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/ram_principal_association)) and the transit gateway resource (see [aws_ram_resource_association](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/ram_resource_association))

self_link.description: A unique URL identifying the transit gateway attachment.

state.description: The state of the transit gateway attachment.

transit_gateway_attachment_id.description: The user-settable name of the transit gateway attachment in HCP.

transit_gateway_id.description: The ID of the user-owned transit gateway in AWS. The AWS region of the transit gateway must match the HVN.

block.description: The AWS transit gateway attachment resource allows you to manage a transit gateway attachment. The transit gateway attachment attaches an HVN to a user-owned transit gateway in AWS. Note that the HVN and transit gateway must be located in the same AWS region.

auto_hvn_to_hvn_peering.description: Enables automatic HVN to HVN peering when creating a secondary cluster in a federation.

cloud_provider.description: The provider where the HCP Consul cluster is located.

cluster_id.description: The ID of the HCP Consul cluster.

connect_enabled.description: Denotes the Consul connect feature should be enabled for this cluster.  Default to true.

consul_automatic_upgrades.description: Denotes that automatic Consul upgrades are enabled.

consul_ca_file.description: The cluster CA file encoded as a Base64 string.

consul_config_file.description: The cluster config encoded as a Base64 string.

consul_private_endpoint_url.description: The private URL for the Consul UI.

consul_public_endpoint_url.description: The public URL for the Consul UI. This will be empty if `public_endpoint` is `false`.

consul_root_token_accessor_id.description: The accessor ID of the root ACL token that is generated upon cluster creation. If a new root token is generated using the `hcp_consul_root_token` resource, this field is no longer valid.

consul_root_token_secret_id.description: The secret ID of the root ACL token that is generated upon cluster creation. If a new root token is generated using the `hcp_consul_root_token` resource, this field is no longer valid.

consul_snapshot_retention.description: The retention policy for Consul snapshots.

consul_version.description: The Consul version of the cluster.

datacenter.description: The Consul data center name of the cluster. If not specified, it is defaulted to the value of `cluster_id`.

hvn_id.description: The ID of the HVN this HCP Consul cluster is associated to.

min_consul_version.description: The minimum Consul version of the cluster. If not specified, it is defaulted to the version that is currently recommended by HCP.

organization_id.description: The ID of the organization this HCP Consul cluster is located in.

primary_link.description: The `self_link` of the HCP Consul cluster which is the primary in the federation setup with this HCP Consul cluster. If not specified, it is a standalone cluster.

project_id.description: The ID of the project this HCP Consul cluster is located in.

public_endpoint.description: Denotes that the cluster has a public endpoint for the Consul UI. Defaults to false.

region.description: The region where the HCP Consul cluster is located.

scale.description: The number of Consul server nodes in the cluster.

self_link.description: A unique URL identifying the HCP Consul cluster.

size.description: The t-shirt size representation of each server VM that this Consul cluster is provisioned with. Valid option for development tier - `x_small`. Valid options for other tiers - `small`, `medium`, `large`. For more details - https://cloud.hashicorp.com/pricing/consul

tier.description: The tier that the HCP Consul cluster will be provisioned as.  Only `development`, `standard` and `plus` are available at this time. See [pricing information](https://cloud.hashicorp.com/pricing/consul).

block.description: The Consul cluster resource allows you to manage an HCP Consul cluster.

accessor_id.description: The accessor ID of the root ACL token.

cluster_id.description: The ID of the HCP Consul cluster.

kubernetes_secret.description: The root ACL token Base64 encoded in a Kubernetes secret.

secret_id.description: The secret ID of the root ACL token.

block.description: The cluster root token resource is the token used to bootstrap the cluster's ACL system. Using this resource to create a new root token for a cluster will invalidate the consul root token accessor id and Consul root token secret id properties of the cluster.

cluster_id.description: The ID of the HCP Consul cluster.

consul_version.description: The version of Consul at the time of snapshot creation.

organization_id.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the project the HCP Consul cluster is located.

project_id.description: The ID of the project the HCP Consul cluster is located.

restored_at.description: Timestamp of when the snapshot was restored. If the snapshot has not been restored, this field will be blank.

size.description: The size of the snapshot in bytes.

snapshot_id.description: The ID of the Consul snapshot

block.description: The Consul snapshot resource allows users to manage Consul snapshots of an HCP Consul cluster. Snapshots currently have a retention policy of 30 days.

cidr_block.description: The CIDR range of the HVN. If this is not provided, the service will provide a default value.

cloud_provider.description: The provider where the HVN is located. Only 'aws' is available at this time.

created_at.description: The time that the HVN was created.

hvn_id.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organization_id.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the HVN is located.

project_id.description: The ID of the HCP project where the HVN is located.

provider_account_id.description: The provider account ID where the HVN is located.

region.description: The region where the HVN is located.

self_link.description: A unique URL identifying the HVN.

block.description: The HVN resource allows you to manage a HashiCorp Virtual Network in HCP.

created_at.description: The time that the HVN route was created.

destination_cidr.description: The destination CIDR of the HVN route.

hvn_link.description: The `self_link` of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

hvn_route_id.description: The ID of the HVN route.

self_link.description: A unique URL identifying the HVN route.

state.description: The state of the HVN route.

target_link.description: A unique URL identifying the target of the HVN route. Examples of the target: [`aws_network_peering`](aws_network_peering.md), [`aws_transit_gateway_attachment`](aws_transit_gateway_attachment.md)

block.description: The HVN route resource allows you to manage an HVN route.

cloud_provider.description: The provider where the HCP Vault cluster is located.

cluster_id.description: The ID of the HCP Vault cluster.

created_at.description: The time that the Vault cluster was created.

hvn_id.description: The ID of the HVN this HCP Vault cluster is associated to.

min_vault_version.description: The minimum Vault version to use when creating the cluster. If not specified, it is defaulted to the version that is currently recommended by HCP.

namespace.description: The name of the customer namespace this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

organization_id.description: The ID of the organization this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

project_id.description: The ID of the project this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

public_endpoint.description: Denotes that the cluster has a public endpoint. Defaults to false.

region.description: The region where the HCP Vault cluster is located.

tier.description: Tier of the HCP Vault cluster. Valid options for tiers - `dev`, `standard_small`, `standard_medium`, `standard_large`. See [pricing information](https://cloud.hashicorp.com/pricing/vault).

vault_private_endpoint_url.description: The private URL for the Vault cluster.

vault_public_endpoint_url.description: The public URL for the Vault cluster. This will be empty if `public_endpoint` is `false`.

vault_version.description: The Vault version of the cluster.

block.description: The Vault cluster resource allows you to manage an HCP Vault cluster.

cluster_id.description: The ID of the HCP Vault cluster.

created_at.description: The time that the admin token was created.

token.description: The admin token of this HCP Vault cluster.

block.description: The Vault cluster admin token resource generates an admin-level token for the HCP Vault cluster.

expires_at.description: The time after which the network peering will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED` or `ACTIVE` state.

hvn_id.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organization_id.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the network peering is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

peer_account_id.description: The account ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peer_vpc_id.description: The ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peer_vpc_region.description: The region of the peer VPC in AWS.

peering_id.description: The ID of the network peering.

project_id.description: The ID of the HCP project where the network peering is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

provider_peering_id.description: The peering connection ID used by AWS.

self_link.description: A unique URL identifying the network peering.

block.description: The AWS network peering data source provides information about an existing network peering between an HVN and a peer AWS VPC.

created_at.description: The time that the transit gateway attachment was created.

expires_at.description: The time after which the transit gateway attachment will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED` or `ACTIVE` state.

hvn_id.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organization_id.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the transit gateway attachment is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

project_id.description: The ID of the HCP project where the transit gateway attachment is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

provider_transit_gateway_attachment_id.description: The transit gateway attachment ID used by AWS.

self_link.description: A unique URL identifying the transit gateway attachment.

state.description: The state of the transit gateway attachment.

transit_gateway_attachment_id.description: The user-settable name of the transit gateway attachment in HCP.

transit_gateway_id.description: The ID of the user-owned transit gateway in AWS.

wait_for_active_state.description: If `true`, Terraform will wait for the transit gateway attachment to reach an `ACTIVE` state before continuing. Default `false`.

block.description: The AWS transit gateway attachment data source provides information about an existing transit gateway attachment.

cluster_id.description: The ID of the HCP Consul cluster.

expose_gossip_ports.description: Denotes that the gossip ports should be exposed.

kubernetes_endpoint.description: The FQDN for the Kubernetes API.

block.description: The Consul agent Helm config data source provides Helm values for a Consul agent running in Kubernetes.

cluster_id.description: The ID of the HCP Consul cluster.

secret.description: The Consul agent configuration in the format of a Kubernetes secret (YAML).

block.description: The agent config Kubernetes secret data source provides Consul agents running in Kubernetes the configuration needed to connect to the Consul cluster.
